intro: Dianthus siphonocalyx, commonly known as the woolly pink, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other popular garden plants like carnations and pinks. Dianthus siphonocalyx typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a desirable ornamental plant in gardens and botanical collections.
